full_summary:
**Open Water Propeller Dynamometer Contract Award Notice**

The National Research Council (NRC) Ocean, Coastal and River Engineering (NRC OCRE) intends to award a contract to H.R. Wallingford Limited for the supply of one (1) open-water propeller dynamometer package. This contract is subject to specific trade agreements, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Revised World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

**Background**
The NRC OCRE has a requirement for a propeller dynamometer to be used in their clear water tow tank and cavitation tunnel facilities. The contractor must provide a system that meets specific minimum essential requirements, including:

* A maximum torque of ±15 Nm and a maximum thrust of -±400 N at 3000 rpm
* A streamline watertight casing with a vertical profile height of <830mm
* An AC drive with fully generative, digitally controlled power converters to control three-phase AC motors in closed-loop speed and torque control
* Compatibility with the H39 Wallingford System

**Contract Details**
The contract is expected to be completed within 40 weeks, with a delivery date scheduled for March 2024. The contract will be subject to the requirements outlined in the attached documentation. H.R. Wallingford Limited is the sole supplier that meets all the minimum essential requirements.

**Suppliers' Right to Submit a Statement of Capabilities**
Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the goods, services, or construction services described in this notice may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the Contracting Authority, Johnathon Gillis, by the closing date of this notice. The statement of capabilities must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements.

**Contact Information**
For inquiries and submissions of statements of capabilities, please contact:
Johnathon Gillis
Contracting Authority
Telephone: 343-552-4124
Email: [Johnathon.Gillis@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Johnathon.Gillis@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)

**Attachments**
None.

**Language**
The contract will be written in English and French, with both languages being official. Any disputes or claims arising under this contract will be resolved in accordance with Canadian law.
